item.title: Vietnam: Vinpearl Luxury Nha Trang On The World’s Top Luxury Resorts
item.dc:creator: caotrang
item.description: Resort Vinpearl Nha Trang is listed as one of the world most wonderful resorts by Huffingtonpost. Vinpearl Luxury Nha Trang is located on the beautiful island of Hon Tre. From on yacht, you will see 84 villas spreading on white sand beach, along distant mountains. Coming to the resort, visitors will have the opportunity to […]
item.content:encoded:
Resort Vinpearl Nha Trang is listed as one of the world most wonderful resorts by Huffingtonpost.

Vinpearl Luxury Nha Trang is located on the beautiful island of Hon Tre. From on yacht, you will see 84 villas spreading on white sand beach, along distant mountains. Coming to the resort, visitors will have the opportunity to enjoy the beauty of the island and perfect care from spa services.

Intercontinental Le Moana, at Bora, Polynesia, France is hanging on the floor of stilt houses on sea and lagoon, and owns some most beautiful bungalow resorts on water.

Float House River Kwai, Kanchanaburi, Thailand offers visitors resorts which are designed to float on the river Khwae Noi.

Conrad Maldives Rangali Island, Alifu Dhaalu Atoll, Maldives is located on two separate islands, visitors come here by boat only. Conrad Rangali owns more than 150 luxury villas, to meet all tastes of tourists.

Likuliku Lagoon Resort, Mamanuca Archipelago, Fiji is located in an area with stunning views, near Nadi. The resort is designed in traditional Fijian architecture and using local materials.

Punta Caracol Acqua Lodge – Bocas del Toro, Panama. The land of Bocas del Toro is originally famous for its colorful nightlife, beautiful parks, and beaches and is one of the popular attractions for backpacking tourists.

Berjaya Langkawi Resort, Langkawi, Malaysia. Langkawi is an archipelago of 99 islands and is known as the “Jewel of Kedah state”.

Song Saa Private Island, Koh Rong, Cambodia is spreading over two pristine islands, called the Song Saa. The resort is full of charm and elegance.

Constance Le Prince Maurice, Poste de Lacq, Mauritius.

item.title: Vietnamese resorts named in world best 50 resorts 2018
item.dc:creator: caotrang
item.description: Two Vietnamese resorts, InterContinental Danang Sun Peninsula Resort and JW Marriott Phu Quoc Emerald Bay Resort & Spa, have been honoured on the list of 50 best resorts in the world in 2018 as announced by the US-based luxury and lifestyle travel magazine, Condé Nast Traveler. The list was revealed based on the results of […]
item.content:encoded:
Two Vietnamese resorts, InterContinental Danang Sun Peninsula Resort and JW Marriott Phu Quoc Emerald Bay Resort & Spa, have been honoured on the list of 50 best resorts in the world in 2018 as announced by the US-based luxury and lifestyle travel magazine, Condé Nast Traveler.

The list was revealed based on the results of the magazine’s Readers’ Choice Awards, including reviews of 429,000 readers.

InterContinental Danang Sun Peninsula Resort in Da Nang ranked 15th on the list and is described as “the perfect pick for some beachside R&R while in Vietnam”.

It also feels much farther away from the “real world” though it is just 30 minutes from the Danang airport, the magazine states. The resort, which opened in 2012, is said to be scattered from the lush hills of the Son Tra Peninsula nature reserve down to the sandy shores of the East Sea and has become one of the top picks in the country for relaxing getaways.

JW Marriott Phu Quoc Emerald Bay Resort & Spa, with the hotel’s 244 rooms and villas with sea views and private pools, is ranked 17th on the list.

The hotel is designed by inimitable hotel designer Bill Bensley with the concept weaving a story around the fictional historic Lamarck University, an homage to the French evolutionary theorist, which was supposedly founded in 1880, then abandoned in the 1940s, and ultimately restored by Marriott, the magazine said.

Although the resort has only been in operation since late 2016, it has continuously been honoured with many prestigious world travel awards.

Source: nhandan
